channel.title: American Thinker
channel.feedburner:browserFriendly: This is an XML content feed. It is intended to be viewed in a newsreader or syndicated to another site, subject to copyright and fair use.

item.title: Culture and the Barbarians at the Gate
item.description: What started the collapse of culture is the collapse of people. It is people that were debased first, and now they're dragging their culture down with them.

item.title: Giants in the Land?
item.description: The real story on Muslims in Latin America.

item.title: Climate Change Conversation Aborted
item.description: An editorial essay by American Chemical Society (ACS) officers Bassam Shakhashiri and Jerry Bell (Science 5 April 2013) extends a gracious invitation for a "respectful conversation" about Climate Change. Yet when I tried to respond, the editors of Science refused to print it.

item.title: 'Pro-Choice' Only Goes so Far
item.description: Sure, you can choose anything you want -- as long as it's an abortion.

item.title: Undercutting Women's Safety
item.description: Liberals claim to be protecting women while taking away their means of self-defense. How rational is this?

item.title: Is Economic Implosion Inevitable?
item.description: Guaranteeing long-term economic growth in the developed world appears to be a simple matter. Unfortunately, like many simple things, it also appears to be extraordinarily difficult.

item.title: 'Should my daughter be a doctor?'
item.description: This should have been the easiest question for me, a doctor myself, to answer. It was the opposite.

item.title: A Criminologist Questions Sandy Hook
item.description: Simply put: what does 30 years' worth of data on mass public shootings say about the probability that Adam Lanza, acting alone, purely privately, and possibly psychotic, killed 27 people and wounded only 2?

item.title: Snubbing Thatcher's Funeral? No, Obama Is Consistent!
item.description: After all, Mrs. Thatcher was a great defender of democracy. Mr. Obama is not.

item.title: The Origination Clause II: Die Harder with a Vengeance, ObamaCare!
item.description: A U.S. district court could soon decide if the Pacific Legal Foundation's (PLF) case against ObamaCare will continue in the U.S. court system. Here's a good way to make sure it does.

item.title: Big Government Mind-Readers
item.description: Although the prescient Orwell recognized the evil place where progressive ideology would ultimately lead, he couldn't have imagined the real technological capabilities of the Big Government of today.

item.title: The U.S. Tortured, Claims Advocacy Group
item.description: Great timing on this one.

item.title: John Kerry and the Great Peace Blocker
item.description: US Secretary of State Kerry is about to encounter the most intractable obstacle to peace in the Middle East, one which escapes the attention of most analysts.

item.title: Why Government Bureaucrats Abuse Taxpayers
item.description: "Ordinary people, simply doing their jobs, and without any particular hostility on their part, can become agents in a terrible destructive process."

item.title: The U.N.'s Latest Attempt to Shackle the USA
item.description: No matter what John Kerry says (and he's saying a lot), the U.N. Convention on the Law of the Sea is not standing up to scrutiny.

item.title: The Epic Failure of the Intel Agencies on the Boston Bombing
item.description: The case is "wide open"? Really? What has American intelligence come to?

item.title: Does Kim Know What Lies Ahead?
item.description: This child has a gun, and also thinks he's god almighty. Time to head for cover.

item.title: Reproductive Justice in Philadelphia
item.description: For decades we've assumed that progressives genuinely did believe that it was a 'blob of tissue' that they were exterminating. Now we see where their true sentiments lie.

item.title: Hiding behind Grieving Mothers
item.description: Obama's new gun-control tactic is the despicable yet -- and that's saying something.

item.title: The Engineer and the Harlot
item.description: In hoarding powers and prerogatives to himself that no president has ever wielded, Obama is taking us to a place of his own choosing: a utopia that more closely resembles Golgotha.

item.title: Am I a Worm-Eating Bigot?
item.description: I want to categorically deny that I am a worm-eating bigot. Worm-eaters are great people.

item.title: What Right of Return?
item.description: There has never in recorded time been a question of absorbing millions of sworn enemies into a host country, much less into a sliver of land the size of Israel, surrounded as it is by innumerable numbers of the same enemy

item.title: President Obama's Plan for A Socialist One Party State
item.description: The last check and balance on President Obama is the Republican majority in the House of Representatives. He has made clear that he intends to remove that check on his power in the 2014 elections.

item.title: Next Up on the Fracking Fear-Mongering List: Earthquakes!
item.description: Linking seismic events to fracking is outright laughable. But that hasn't stopped the eco-warriors from trying.

item.title: Michael Bloomberg's Gun Stings
item.description: If this were another issue, the MSM would call this a "witch-hunt."
